Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: lol... Well I figured a pool being able to stake would be fine, Although at some point it should stake and mine at once, but its not that useful for most chains... Unless they use a CPU algo of some kind daemon mining isnt really useful at all.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: literally at once would have to be daemon, but it's no small feat to support alternating *and* other chains as well is what I was getting at

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: I've started it 5 times

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes. Well the staking loop needs to be inside its own thread and it needs a diffrent way to be switched on and off, that way PoW mining can have some threads aswell.. but once I got staking working this good, I really didnt want to touch it again, it was no easy task to get it in a usable state.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And a pool that switches only when diff wall is down, is well... I dont know what that would do to the chain, I think it would effectivly over time reduce PoW difficulty.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: I don't think there's a user-base large enough that would actually do it to support the work to do same time in 1 daemon, tbh

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because its calculated as an average of the PoW difficulty over the last 100 blocks... if you ONLY PoW mine when diff is low, you will lower the difficulty.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I agree, unless I find myself with nothing to do its not likey I will be doing it. If ppl want that, user VRSC to launch the chain lol.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: the current segid gets a time "advantage", but it's not a guarantee that someone will have something in that seg that is viable and then it goes to the next

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
